item.title: Item on Object problem
item.dc:creator: @doom_j doom_j
item.description:
@doom_j wrote:

itemID is not a defined variable, this is one of the easiest errors you can get in Java.

You need to define itemID, or rename it to the correct variable name.

Read full topic

item.title: Item on Object problem

item.description:
@sageofmali wrote:

Should be like this: if(UsedOnObjectID == 9398 && HasItemAmount(995, 2147000000)){ deleteItem(995, 2147000000); addItem(1939, 1); sM("Message."); }

item.title: Item on Object problem
item.dc:creator: @teufel teufel
item.description:
@teufel wrote:

So i added this if (itemID == 3741 && objectID == 165) { sM("You melt the key..."); deleteItem(2404, 1); addItem(995, 1); }
Which says if I use a frozen key on an incinerator the key will be deleted and I will get 1 coin right???

For some reason java thinks I’m wrong and gave me this error

client.java:15213: cannot find symbol symbol : variable itemID location: class client if (itemID == 3741 && objectID == 165) ^ 1 error Finished! Press any key to continue . . .

What is the correct way to do this other than my 5 second hard-coding way?

Read full topic
